Core:PCProperties.Core:Property:
(\{ (\{ 6, 3 \}), (\{ "text", "\
\\r\\n \Edit - guest - Smith's Armory\\\r\\n \\\\r\\n \\\r\\n\\\r\\n\\r\\n\
Members List\" \}), (\{ "members_list", "" \}), (\{ "h3", "Guild Inventory" \}), (\{ "inventory", "" \}), (\{ "page", "Main Page", "default" \}) \})

(\{ (\{ 6, 3 \}), (\{ "text", "\
\\r\\n \Edit - guest - Smith's Armory\\\r\\n \\\\r\\n \\\r\\n\\\r\\n" \}), (\{ "text", "\
Smith's Armory\\\r\\n\\\r\\nSmith's Armory is an independent blacksmiths guild that specializes in weapons and armor. Although independent from the Great Houses, our goal is not to compete with them but to form a strong working relationship with them, as well as commoner guilds, in order to provide quality arms to the city as a whole. \\r\\n\\\r\\n" \}), (\{ "page", "Price List", "price list" \}) \})

(\{ (\{ 6, 4 \}), (\{ "text", "\
\\r\\n \Edit - guest - Smith's Armory\\\r\\n \\\\r\\n \\\r\\n\\\r\\n" \}), (\{ "text", "\\\r\\n\
Sir Bayard\\\r\\n2 kite shields (engraved with Avo crest)\
\\r\\n2 steel longswords (blue steel crossguard hilts)\
\\r\\n1 steel warhammer (wooden haft)\
\
\\r\\nNote: We will provide blue steel. He will provide the rest of the materials needed for this order." \}), (\{ "paragraph", "\
Sageeth\\\r\\nTwo simple dagger sheaths." \}), (\{ "paragraph", "\
Senora\\\r\\ndouble bladed battle axe, preferably from steel" \}), (\{ "text", "\" \}) \})

(\{ (\{ 6, 6 \}), (\{ "text", "\\\r\\n\
Bruno\\\r\\n\
\\Position: Guild Leader, Master Weaponsmith, Master Armorsmith\\\\\r\\nBruno grew up an only child and learned the art of smithing from his father, Boris. He came to Triskellian five years ago and wasted no time putting his skills to work. He was a member of the Blacksmith guild and also earned a job as smith for the Black Company. Although Bruno is no longer a part of these guilds, he wishes for everyone to know he cares much about them for they are what made him who he is today. He is married to Shaer Smith and they have a perfect daughter Rachelle.\\r\\n\\r\\n\" \}), (\{ "page", "Main Page", "default" \}), (\{ "text", "\
\\r\\n \Edit - guest - Smith's Armory\\\r\\n \\\\r\\n \\\r\\n\\\r\\n" \}) \})

(\{ (\{ 6, 6 \}), (\{ "text", "\
\\r\\n \Edit - guest - Smith's Armory\\\r\\n \\\\r\\n \\\r\\n\\\r\\n" \}), (\{ "text", "\\\r\\n\\\r\\n \\\r\\n\
\\r\\n\\r\\n\\\r\\n\\r\\n\\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Weaponsmiths */\\r\\n var weaponsmith = new Array();\\r\\n weaponsmith[0] = new Array(\\"Bruno\\", 24);\\r\\n weaponsmith[1] = new Array(\\"Elher\\", 5);\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Armorsmiths */\\r\\n var armorsmith = new Array();\\r\\n armorsmith[0] = new Array(\\"Bruno\\", 24);\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Blacksmiths */\\r\\n var blacksmith = new Array();\\r\\n blacksmith[0] = new Array(\\"Elher\\", 4);\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Metal List */\\r\\n /* m[x] = new Array(\\"Metal Name\\", p); */\\r\\n /* p = price per rod */\\r\\n var mats = new Array();\\r\\n mats[0] = new Array(\\"Copper\\", 4);\\r\\n mats[1] = new Array(\\"Bronze\\", 7);\\r\\n mats[2] = new Array(\\"Iron\\", 10);\\r\\n mats[3] = new Array(\\"Brass\\", 15);\\r\\n mats[4] = new Array(\\"Leather\\", 4);\\r\\n mats[5] = new Array(\\"Suede\\", 4);\\r\\n mats[6] = new Array(\\"Velvet\\", 4);\\r\\n\\r\\n var fencingBlades = new Array();\\r\\n fencingBlades[0] = new Array(\\"Side-sword Blade\\", 3, 11, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n fencingBlades[1] = new Array(\\"Foil Blade\\", 3, 12, \\"\\", \\"The foil is a fencing blade, with the end capped, to avoid injuries.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n fencingBlades[2] = new Array(\\"Tuck Blade\\", 3, 13, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n fencingBlades[3] = new Array(\\"Cutlass Blade\\", 3, 15, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n fencingBlades[4] = new Array(\\"Rapier Blade\\", 3, 16, \\"\\", \\"A long, relatively narrow (but thick) blade, that sacrifices cutting power for greater reach and thrusting ability. A properly measured rapier blade should reach from the ground to bottom of the wielders ribs. The rapier blade can be quite unwieldy, and is of little use in close quarters.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n fencingBlades[5] = new Array(\\"Sabre Blade\\", 3, 18, \\"\\", \\"The fastest of cutting sword blades, the sabre is a wedge-shaped, curved blade. A footmans sabre is generally fairly straight, and a horsemans sabre is dramatically curved, so the wielder can keep hold of the weapon while striking at the gallop.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n fencingBlades[6] = new Array(\\"Smallsword Blade\\", 3, 22, \\"\\", \\"Often with no cutting ability whatsoever, a smallsword blade is designed as a rapier, but is as short as a normal sword blade. A properly measured smallsword blade reaches from the ground to the wielder's hips.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Sword Blades */\\r\\n /* new Array(\\"Sword Blade Type\\", feet, difficulty, image, text description, skill category); */\\r\\n /* f = feet used; d = diffculty; */\\r\\n var swordBlades = new Array();\\r\\n swordBlades[0] = new Array(\\"Generic Sword Blade\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"Just a plain sword blade.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[1] = new Array(\\"Practice Blade\\", 3, 6, \\"\\", \\"A blunt blade is used when practicing, so as not to injure the wielders opponent.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[2] = new Array(\\"Arming Blade\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"The classic double-edged knightly blade. Known as a diamond- section blade, the arming blade has a ridge in the middle, along the length of the blade.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[3] = new Array(\\"Short Blade\\", 3, 4, \\"\\", \\"An older style of arming blade, featuring an indent along the middle of the blade. This design allows for reinforced edges with the indent reducing the overall weight.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[4] = new Array(\\"Longsword Blade\\", 3, 8, \\"\\", \\"A longer blade designed for two-handed use. Usually longswords are double-edged.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[5] = new Array(\\"Claymore Blade\\", 3, 10, \\"\\", \\"The claymore is of Bisclavret design. A very wide and relatively short two-handed blade that is manouverable enough to be used easily in single combat.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[6] = new Array(\\"Backsword Blade\\", 3, 14, \\"\\", \\"A modern design that features a full, front edge and a partial back edge. As the back edge is not sharp along most of the length, this blade can be thicker and stronger.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[7] = new Array(\\"Scimitar Blade\\", 3, 20, \\"\\", \\"A steel scimitar. The scimitar, or shamshir, is a weapon of oriental origins. The blade is very similar to a sabre, in that it is a curved blade with a sharp front edge, however it is much wider than a traditional sabre.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n swordBlades[8] = new Array(\\"Zweihander Blade\\", 3, 24, \\"\\", \\"An enormously long, double-edged two-hander blade, designed for battle. Zweihander blades are particularly effective when dealing with massed spears.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Dagger Blades */\\r\\n /* new Array(\\"Dagger Blade Type\\", f, d); */\\r\\n /* f = feet used; d = difficulty; */\\r\\n var daggerBlades = new Array();\\r\\n daggerBlades[0] = new Array(\\"Generic Dagger Blade\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"Just a plain dagger blade.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[1] = new Array(\\"Rondel Blade\\", 3, 3, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[2] = new Array(\\"Dirk Blade\\", 3, 5, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[3] = new Array(\\"Gauche Blade\\", 3, 7, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[4] = new Array(\\"Poniard Blade\\", 3, 7, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[5] = new Array(\\"Misericorde Blade\\", 3, 9, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[6] = new Array(\\"Ear Blade\\", 3, 13, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[7] = new Array(\\"Stiletto*\\", 2, 16, \\"\\", \\"A stiletto is one piece cast steel handle and blade. It is a short knife with a long slender blade suited for stabbing, its narrow shape ending in a rigid pointed end allows it to penetrate deeply.\
\*Hilt included\\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[8] = new Array(\\"Kris Blade\\", 3, 17, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[9] = new Array(\\"Swordbreaker Blade\\", 3, 19, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n daggerBlades[10] = new Array(\\"Trident Blade\\", 3, 21, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Hilts */\\r\\n /* new Array(\\"Hilt Type\\", f, d); */\\r\\n /* f = feet used; d = difficulty; */\\r\\n var hilts = new Array();\\r\\n hilts[0] = new Array(\\"Hilt\\", 2, 2, \\"\\", \\"A plain weapon hilt.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n hilts[1] = new Array(\\"Crossguard\\", 2, 4, \\"http://www.strongblade.com/prod/prodimages/sba-twistedclaymore1_th.jpg\\", \\"A simple cruciform device that serves to protect the wielders hand without getting in the way during fighting. This is an older style of guard, popular on large two-handed swords and antiques.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n hilts[2] = new Array(\\"Bar Guard\\", 2, 6, \\"http://www.hadesign.co.uk/SRS/images/short1.jpg\\", \\"Also known as a knucklebow, a bar or strip protecting the front of the hand. Knucklebows are useful for swords that are often carried everyday, as the guard is flat and doesn't get in the way. For this reason, knucklebowed swords are also very fast to draw.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n hilts[3] = new Array(\\"Bell Guard\\", 2, 8, \\"http://www.albion-swords.com/images/swords/albion/late/lady-vivamus-05.jpg\\", \\"A development of the knucklebow. The strip protecting the hand is widened and curved around the wielders knuckles. This style of guard is popular on pirate cutlasses.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n hilts[4] = new Array(\\"Basket Guard\\", 2, 10, \\"http://swordforum.com/fall99/1798hilt.gif\\", \\"An intricate cage surrounds the hilt, protecting the wielder's hand. This is the hilt of choice for the Bisclavret and due to their close-fitting nature are best on cutting, rather than thrusting swords.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n hilts[5] = new Array(\\"Swept Hilt\\", 2, 12, \\"http://www.macallenarmourers.com/images/rp4-72-a-web.jpg\\", \\"More a work of art than anything else, the swept hilt is popular on rapiers and smallswords. A swept hilt consists of an intricate knotwork of bars, designed to protect the hand from thrusting attacks.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Sheaths */\\r\\n /* new Array(\\"Sheath Type\\", f, d); */\\r\\n /* f = feet used; d = difficulty; */\\r\\n var scabbards = new Array();\\r\\n scabbards[0] = new Array(\\"Hip Scabbard\\", 5, 2, \\"\\", \\"A scabbard large enough to hold a regular-sized sword, designed to hang from a belt or baldric.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"all\\");\\r\\n scabbards[1] = new Array(\\"Back Scabbard\\", 5, 2, \\"\\", \\"A scabbard large enough to hold a regular-sized sword. This scabbard is designed to hang diagonally across the back, slung from one shoulder.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"all\\");\\r\\n scabbards[2] = new Array(\\"Dagger Sheath\\", 5, 2, \\"\\", \\"A sheath designed to hold daggers and knives\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"all\\");\\r\\n scabbards[3] = new Array(\\"Weapon Strap\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"all\\");\\r\\n scabbards[4] = new Array(\\"Back Harness\\", 3, 3, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"cloth\\");\\r\\n scabbards[5] = new Array(\\"Holster\\", 4, 23, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"cloth\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Polearms */\\r\\n /* new Array(\\"Polearm Type\\", f, d); */\\r\\n /* f = feet used; d = difficulty; */\\r\\n var polearms = new Array();\\r\\n polearms[0] = new Array(\\"Spearhead\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"A plain spearhead.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[1] = new Array(\\"Leaf-bladed Spearhead\\", 3, 4, \\"\\", \\"The blade measures approximately fifteen inches in length from tip to base. The shape of the spearhead widens toward the base before tapering inward at the end.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[2] = new Array(\\"Harpoon Spearhead\\", 3, 5, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[3] = new Array(\\"Craoiseach Spearhead\\", 3, 5, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[4] = new Array(\\"Broad-bladed Spearhead\\", 3, 8, \\"\\", \\"The blade measures approximately ten inches in length from tip to base. This blade is shorter and wider than most traditional spearheads, with lugs (or wings) jutting from the base of the blade. The lugs prevent the spear from penetrating too deeply into a foe, allowing for quick recovery of a weapon and preventing the point from snapping off inside an opponent.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[5] = new Array(\\"Javelin Head\\", 3, 12, \\"\\", \\"The blade is small, measuring only six inches in length. Intended mainly as a weapon thrown at close range, it could also serve as a light spear in a pinch.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[6] = new Array(\\"Halberd\\", 3, 14, \\"\\", \\"The halberd consists of a blade, shaped like an axehead, with a hook mounted on a pole approximately 1.6 metres long and topped with a long bronze spike.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[7] = new Array(\\"Hewing Spearhead\\", 3, 16, \\"\\", \\"The blade measures approximately eighteen inches in length from tip to base. The particular design of this spearhead allows it to thrust and cut with equal effectiveness.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n polearms[8] = new Array(\\"Gae Bolga Spearhead\\", 3, 17, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var axes = new Array();\\r\\n axes[0] = new Array(\\"Axehead\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"A plain axehead.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n axes[1] = new Array(\\"Francisca Axehead\\", 3, 6, \\"\\", \\"A smaller style of axe, the francisca is generally used as a throwing weapon due to its light weight. It can also serve as a melee weapon when nothing else is available.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n axes[2] = new Array(\\"Single-bladed Battle Axehead\\", 3, 10, \\"\\", \\"Designed for hacking and hewing your enemy into large pieces, the battle axe is a common weapon in the hands of any soldier on the battlefield. The blade on one side of the haft means there is only one way to swing this weapon.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n axes[3] = new Array(\\"Double-bladed Battle Axehead\\", 3, 14, \\"\\", \\"Designed for hacking and hewing your enemy into large pieces, the battle axe is a common weapon in the hands of any soldier on the battlefield. This is a more fearsome version of the battle axe, with two large blades, one on either side of the haft.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n axes[4] = new Array(\\"Lochaber Axehead\\", 3, 18, \\"\\", \\"Similar in design to the halberd, the lochaber axes posses a curved cutting blade rough eighteen inches long. In addition a tip for thrusting and a hook on the back of the blade can be used to dismount riders or assist in scaling walls.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var maces = new Array();\\r\\n maces[0] = new Array(\\"Mace Head\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"A plain mace head.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n maces[1] = new Array(\\"Aspergillum Head\\", 3, 6, \\"\\", \\"Mimicking items used in holy rituals by the penitents of S'allumer, the holy water sprinkler is a small, dainty (by comparison) weapon. Ease of use makes it a popular weapon.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n maces[2] = new Array(\\"Flanged Mace Head\\", 3, 12, \\"\\", \\"Designed to defeat heavy armor the main danger of a mace is the sheer weight of the head. Of course, the spikes (or flanges) certainly help to punch through a tough plate of metal.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n maces[3] = new Array(\\"Warhammer Head\\", 3, 18, \\"\\", \\"In the same vein as maces, the war hammer is a weapon that helps to meet the ever increasing demand for weapons capable of inflicting grievous injury to armored opponents.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n maces[4] = new Array(\\"Maul Head\\", 3, 22, \\"\\", \\"If a mace is just fine, then a maul is overkill. An enormous hammer head is attached to a haft tall as a man and swung with both hands. Not intended for individual combat, this weapon is a dire threat on the battlefield against groups of tightly packed opponents.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var whips = new Array();\\r\\n whips[0] = new Array(\\"Riding Crop\\", 3, 17, \\"\\", \\"A plain mace head.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"leather\\");\\r\\n whips[1] = new Array(\\"Scourge\\", 3, 19, \\"\\", \\"A plain mace head.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"leather\\");\\r\\n whips[2] = new Array(\\"Bullwhip\\", 3, 21, \\"\\", \\"A plain mace head.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"leather\\");\\r\\n whips[3] = new Array(\\"Chain Whip\\", 3, 24, \\"\\", \\"A plain mace head.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var haft = new Array();\\r\\n haft[0] = new Array(\\"Haft\\", 2, 2, \\"\\", \\"The shaft that allows the wielder to handle the weapon. The length is what gives this weapon its reach. Used for axes, spears, and maces. Seek a carpenter for a wooden haft.\\", \\"weaponsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Armor */\\r\\n /* new Array(\\"Armor Type\\", f, d); */\\r\\n /* f = feet used; d = difficulty; */\\r\\n var head = new Array();\\r\\n head[0] = new Array(\\"Helmet\\", 4, 12, \\"\\", \\"Helmets protect the wearer against blows to the head.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[1] = new Array(\\"Kettle Hat\\", 4, 13, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[2] = new Array(\\"Morion\\", 4, 13, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[3] = new Array(\\"Cervelliere\\", 4, 14, \\"\\", \\"A copper cervelliere. It is a round, close-fitting skull cap; this helmet was frequently worn beneath a great helm (heaume).\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[4] = new Array(\\"Capeline\\", 4, 15, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[5] = new Array(\\"Hounskull\\", 4, 15, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[6] = new Array(\\"Spangenhelm\\", 4, 16, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[7] = new Array(\\"Bascinet\\", 4, 17, \\"\\", \\"A copper bascinet. It is an open-faced, military helmet, typically fitted with a hinged visor and worn with a gorget. For comfort, there is a linen blend cloth stuffed with wool on this inside of the close-fitting helmet, and, though there is no chin strap, this helmet was often tied to a surcoat or armor to prevent it from being lifted off the wearer's head.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[8] = new Array(\\"Burgonet\\", 4, 18, \\"\\", \\"A burgonet with bevor. This helm affords protection to the neck as well as the head and face. It boasts a fully articulated falling buffe that is secured by leather straps which can be adjusted to allow for better air flow and visibility. An impressive fin decorates the top, while the visor is adorned with simple cut-out crosses.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[9] = new Array(\\"Barbute\\", 4, 18, \\"\\", \\"Characterized by a rounded skull, a t-shaped opening for the face, a strongly flared tail, and cheek pieces, this helmet has been executed to form a very elegant, flowing defense for the head. It is layered on top with velvet cloth which has been covered with a latten floral adornment.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[10] = new Array(\\"Sallet\\", 4, 18, \\"\\", \\"Suitable for foot or mounted combat, this two-tiered helmet is constructed with a tail to protect the back of the head and neck. It sits flush on a bevor, which protects the chin and throat. Featuring a moveable visor which provides for good ventilation and visibility, and a bevor with falling buffe, it is forged of iron and fully lined.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[11] = new Array(\\"Armet\\", 4, 20, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[12] = new Array(\\"Heaume\\", 4, 24, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"head\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[13] = new Array(\\"Gorget\\", 3, 16, \\"\\", \\"A cover for the neck, shoulders, clavicles, and sternum, the top attaches directly to the base of a helmet while the bottom fastens to a breastplate or cuirass.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"neck\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n head[14] = new Array(\\"Bevor\\", 4, 20, \\"\\", \\"A piece of armor designed to protect the neck, much like a gorget. It is comprised of multiple articulated lames around the neck and chin, and is typically worn in conjunction with a sallet or a burgonet in a form known as a falling buffe. It combines with other pieces to provide protection for the whole of the head and neck.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"neck\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var shoulders = new Array();\\r\\n shoulders[0] = new Array(\\"Pauldrons\\", 3, 15, \\"\\", \\"A pair of bronze pauldrons; larger than spaulders, these are a component of plate armor made to cover the shoulders, armpits, and sometimes parts of the back and chest. Typically, pauldrons tend to consist of a single dome-shaped piece to cover the shoulder with multiple lam\�s attached to defend the arm.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"armpits, shoulders, shoulderblades\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n shoulders[1] = new Array(\\"Ailettes\\", 2, 3, \\"\\", \\"Usually made from cuir bouilli (sometimes plate or parchment), ailettes attached to the shoulders by means of silk of leather cord. They are usually flat and rectangular in shape, and usually decorated with heraldic designs\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"shoulders\\", \\"metal/leather\\");\\r\\n shoulders[2] = new Array(\\"Spaulders\\", 3, 13, \\"\\", \\"The bronze spaulders, a part of plate armor, are armored plates forged to protect the upper arms and shoulders. As these do not cover the arm holes when worn with a cuirass, the gaps may be defended by besagews or simply left bare, exposing the mail beneath.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"shoulders, biceps\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n shoulders[3] = new Array(\\"Besagews\\", 1, 7, \\"\\", \\"The bronze besagews are circular defenses used to protect the under arms, the armpits particularly, as part of a harness of plate armor.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"armpits\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var torso = new Array();\\r\\n torso[0] = new Array(\\"Lorica\\", 2, 2, \\"\\", \\"The front is curved to protect from spear blows to the chest.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"chest\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n torso[1] = new Array(\\"Cuirass\\", 6, 4, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"chest\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n torso[2] = new Array(\\"Breastplate\\", 4, 8, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"back, shoulders, chest, waist\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n torso[3] = new Array(\\"Gauntlets\\", 4, 14, \\"\\", \\"A pair of iron plates worn as gloves. They protect the backs of hands and the wrists, and are made of many smaller plates that allow flexibility of the fingers.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"hands, fingers\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n torso[4] = new Array(\\"Culet\\", 4, 8, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"back, rump\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n torso[5] = new Array(\\"Rondel\\", 1, 1, \\"\\", \\"This is a circular piece of metal used for protection, as a harness of plate armor, or attached to a helmet, breastplate, couter, or on a gauntlet.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"torso\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var arms = new Array();\\r\\n arms[0] = new Array(\\"Rerebraces\\", 4, 22, \\"\\", \\"A pair of iron vambraces consisting of two upper cannons on the upper arms, it is usually connected to the lower cannon, protection for the forearms, by couters at the elbow.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"biceps\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n arms[1] = new Array(\\"Couters\\", 1, 11, \\"\\", \\"The iron couters are a component in a piece of plate armor, they are used in defense of the elbows. They are forged into an articulate joint.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"elbows\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n arms[2] = new Array(\\"Vambraces\\", 4, 22, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"forearms\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n arms[3] = new Array(\\"Bracers\\", 3, 2, \\"\\", \\"A pair of plates wrapped around the wrists, usually worn by archers or fencers for protection.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"wrists\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var waist = new Array();\\r\\n waist[0] = new Array(\\"Fauld\\", 5, 21, \\"\\", \\"The bronze fauld, a piece of plate armor, are designed to be worn below a breastplate for the protection of the waist and hips. Taking the form of bands of metal surrounding both legs, potentially surrounding the entire hips, this form is similar to that of a skirt.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"hips, waist\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n waist[1] = new Array(\\"Bases\\", 5, 23, \\"\\", \\"This is plate armor for the upper legs, in imitation of the shape and style of cloth bases. It is worn for dismounted combat. There is a detachable rear piece for the metal bases to allow the man-at-arms to sit on a destrier, or any other lizard, although even without the rear piece it must have been rather difficult to mount and dismount when wearing plate armor bases.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"thighs, waist, hips\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n waist[2] = new Array(\\"Cuisses\\", 3, 18, \\"\\", \\"The bronze cuisses. It is a curved shield made to protect the thighs from a thrust from below. These typically cover chausses and may have a pair of poleyns directly attached to them.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"thighs\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n waist[3] = new Array(\\"Tassets\\", 4, 19, \\"\\", \\"The iron tassets are a piece of plate armor made to protect the upper legs. Either hanging from a breastplate or faulds, the plates can be forged from a single piece or segmented.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"thighs\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n waist[4] = new Array(\\"Codpiece\\", 1, 9, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"groin\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var legs = new Array();\\r\\n legs[0] = new Array(\\"Poleyns\\", 2, 11, \\"\\", \\"Developed with an articulated construction, these are plates designed for protecting the knees. They can be attached to cuisses or greaves, as desired.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"knees, thighs\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n legs[1] = new Array(\\"Schynbalds\\", 2, 3, \\"\\", \\"These are metal plates strapped over chausses, each schynbald was a single piece of metal that covered the front and outside of the shin. They did not enclose the lower leg: hence, they were not true greaves.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"shins\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n legs[2] = new Array(\\"Greaves\\", 4, 4, \\"\\", \\"A pair of plates wrapping the front sides of the lower legs for protection.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"calves, ankles\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n legs[3] = new Array(\\"Sabatons\\", 4, 10, \\"\\", \\"These are rivetted plates that are worn upon the feet and protect them from damage while allowing movement and flexibility.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"feet\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n var armenhance = new Array();\\r\\n armenhance[0] = new Array(\\"Spikes\\", 1, 12, \\"\\", \\"Spikes that can be added to armor and shields.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"NA\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n armenhance[1] = new Array(\\"Stud\\", 1, 8, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"NA\\", \\"metal\\"); \\r\\n\\r\\n var miscarmor = new Array();\\r\\n miscarmor[0] = new Array(\\"Chainmail\\", 5, 6, \\"\\", \\"A roll of chainmail that can be taken to a tailor or seamstress.\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"not worn\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\n /* Shields */\\r\\n var shields = new Array();\\r\\n shields[0] = new Array(\\"Shield\\", 5, 2, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n shields[1] = new Array(\\"Buckler\\", 5, 6, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n shields[2] = new Array(\\"Kite Shield\\", 5, 8, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n shields[3] = new Array(\\"Heater Shield\\", 5, 10, \\"\\", \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n shields[4] = new Array(\\"Tower Shield\\", 5, 14, \\"\\", \\"armorsmith\\", \\"\\", \\"metal\\");\\r\\n \\r\\n\\r\\nfunction switchid(id)\{\\t\\r\\n ID = document.getElementById(id); \\r\\n\\r\\n if(ID.style.display == 'block') \{\\r\\n\\t hidediv(id);\\r\\n \} else \{ \\r\\n\\t showdiv(id);\\r\\n \}\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction hideallids()\{\\r\\n\\t//loop through the array and hide each element by id\\r\\n\\tfor (var i=0;i\<ids.length;i++)\{\\r\\n\\t\\thidediv(ids[i]);\\r\\n\\t\}\\t\\t \\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction hidediv(id) \{\\r\\n\\t//safe function to hide an element with a specified id\\r\\n\\tif (document.getElementById) \{ // DOM3 = IE5, NS6\\r\\n\\t\\tdocument.getElementById(id).style.display = 'none';\\r\\n\\t\}\\r\\n\\telse \{\\r\\n\\t\\tif (document.layers) \{ // Netscape 4\\r\\n\\t\\t\\tdocument.id.display = 'none';\\r\\n\\t\\t\}\\r\\n\\t\\telse \{ // IE 4\\r\\n\\t\\t\\tdocument.all.id.style.display = 'none';\\r\\n\\t\\t\}\\r\\n\\t\}\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction showdiv(id) \{\\r\\n\\t//safe function to show an element with a specified id\\r\\n\\t\\t \\r\\n\\tif (document.getElementById) \{ // DOM3 = IE5, NS6\\r\\n\\t\\tdocument.getElementById(id).style.display = 'block';\\r\\n\\t\}\\r\\n\\telse \{\\r\\n\\t\\tif (document.layers) \{ // Netscape 4\\r\\n\\t\\t\\tdocument.id.display = 'block';\\r\\n\\t\\t\}\\r\\n\\t\\telse \{ // IE 4\\r\\n\\t\\t\\tdocument.all.id.style.display = 'block';\\r\\n\\t\\t\}\\r\\n\\t\}\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction calcPrice(metalPrice, feetUsed, itemDifficulty) \{\\r\\n return (metalPrice/10) * feetUsed + (itemDifficulty);\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction getSmiths(skill, level) \{\\r\\n var smithtemp;\\r\\n var i;\\r\\n var rstr;\\r\\n\\r\\n if(skill == \\"weaponsmith\\") \{\\r\\n smithtemp = weaponsmith;\\r\\n \} else if(skill == \\"armorsmith\\") \{\\r\\n smithtemp = armorsmith;\\r\\n \} else \{\\r\\n smithtemp = blacksmith;\\r\\n \}\\r\\n\\r\\n rstr = \\"\\
\\\* \\\\\";\\r\\n for(i = 0; i \< smithtemp.length; i++) \{\\r\\n if(level \<= smithtemp[i][1]) \{\\r\\n rstr += \\"\\\\\" + smithtemp[i][0] + \\" \\\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \} \\r\\n rstr += \\"\\\\";\\r\\n\\r\\n return rstr;\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction buildList(listType, listArr) \{\\r\\n\\r\\n var temp = listArr;\\r\\n\\r\\n var returnStr;\\r\\n\\r\\n var sz = mats.length + 1;\\r\\n\\r\\n returnStr = \\"\\
\\\\\\\" + listType + \\"\\\\\\\

\

\Covers: \\" + temp[i][6] + \\"\\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\\\";\\r\\n\\r\\n for(j=0; j\<mats.length; j++) \{\\r\\n if(temp[i][7] == \\"all\\") \{\\r\\n \\t sum = calcPrice(mats[j][1], temp[i][1], temp[i][2]);\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\" + sum.toFixed(0) + \\"\\\";\\r\\n \} else if(temp[i][7] == \\"cloth\\") \{\\r\\n if(mats[j][0] == \\"Leather\\" \|\| mats[j][0] == \\"Suede\\" \|\| mats[j][0] == \\"Velvet\\") \{\\r\\n \\t sum = calcPrice(mats[j][1], temp[i][1], temp[i][2]);\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\" + sum.toFixed(0) + \\"\\\";\\r\\n \} else \{\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\x\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \} else if(temp[i][7] == \\"leather\\") \{\\r\\n if(mats[j][0] == \\"Leather\\") \{\\r\\n \\t sum = calcPrice(mats[j][1], temp[i][1], temp[i][2]);\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\" + sum.toFixed(0) + \\"\\\";\\r\\n \} else \{\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\x\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \} else if(temp[i][7] == \\"metal/leather\\") \{\\r\\n if(mats[j][0] == \\"Suede\\" \|\| mats[j][0] == \\"Velvet\\") \{\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\x\\\";\\r\\n \} else \{\\r\\n \\t sum = calcPrice(mats[j][1], temp[i][1], temp[i][2]);\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\" + sum.toFixed(0) + \\"\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \} else \{\\r\\n if(mats[j][0] == \\"Suede\\" \|\| mats[j][0] == \\"Velvet\\" \|\| mats[j][0] == \\"Leather\\") \{\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\x\\\";\\r\\n \} else \{\\r\\n \\t sum = calcPrice(mats[j][1], temp[i][1], temp[i][2]);\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\" + sum.toFixed(0) + \\"\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \}\\r\\n \\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\";\\r\\n \}\\r\\n\\r\\n returnStr = returnStr + \\"\\\";\\r\\n\\r\\n return returnStr; \\r\\n\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\nfunction getData(dataType) \{\\r\\n\\r\\n switch(dataType) \{\\r\\n case \\"fencingBlades\\":\\r\\n return fencingBlades;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"swordBlades\\":\\r\\n return swordBlades;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"daggerBlades\\":\\r\\n return daggerBlades;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"hilts\\":\\r\\n return hilts;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"sheaths\\":\\r\\n return scabbards;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"polearms\\":\\r\\n return polearms;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"axes\\":\\r\\n return axes;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"maces\\":\\r\\n return maces;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"haft\\":\\r\\n return haft;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"head\\":\\r\\n return head;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"shoulders\\":\\r\\n return shoulders;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"torso\\":\\r\\n return torso;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"arms\\":\\r\\n return arms;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"waist\\":\\r\\n return waist;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"legs\\":\\r\\n return legs;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"armenhance\\":\\r\\n return armenhance;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"miscarmor\\":\\r\\n return miscarmor;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n case \\"shields\\":\\r\\n return shields;\\r\\n break;\\r\\n default:\\r\\n document.write(\\"Error!\\");\\r\\n break;\\r\\n \}\\r\\n\}\\r\\n\\r\\n\\\r\\n\\r\\n\\\r\\n\\r\\n\\\r\\n\\\r\\n document.write(\\"\\
Weapon Blades and Hilts\\\\");\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Fencing Blades\\", getData(\\"fencingBlades\\")));\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Sword Blades\\", getData(\\"swordBlades\\")));\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Dagger Blades\\", getData(\\"daggerBlades\\")));\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Hilts\\", getData(\\"hilts\\")));\\r\\n\\r\\n document.write(\\"\\
Weapon Heads and Hafts\\\\");\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Polearms\\", getData(\\"polearms\\")));\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Axes\\", getData(\\"axes\\")));\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Maces\\", getData(\\"maces\\")));\\r\\n document.write(buildList(\\"Hafts\\", getData(\\"haft\\")));\\r\\n\\r\\n document.write(\\"\\
